title:
Localization in Dynamic Planar Environments Using Few Distance
  Measurements
authors: Michael M. Bilevich, Shahar Guini, Dan Halperin
abstract:
We present a method for determining the unknown location of a sensor placed
in a known 2D environment in the presence of unknown dynamic obstacles, using
only few distance measurements. We present guarantees on the quality of the
localization, which are robust under mild assumptions on the density of the
unknown/dynamic obstacles in the known environment. We demonstrate the
effectiveness of our method in simulated experiments for different environments
and varying dynamic-obstacle density. Our open source software is available at
https://github.com/TAU-CGL/vb-fdml2-public.
